abstract: With the openings in 15 Latin American countries, Apple now operates iTunes  in 51 countries.
snippet: With the openings in 15 Latin American countries, Apple now operates iTunes  in 51 countries.
lead_paragraph: Apple quietly announced on Tuesday that it had opened its iTunes store in Brazil and 15 other countries in Latin America, including Argentina, Venezuela, Chile, Colombia, Nicaragua and Peru. Apple now operates the iTunes music store in 51 countries.

headline.main: ITunes Opens in Latin America, Challenging Rival Services
